Description: Wooden cosmetic-spoon in form of girl swimming with duck.
Curator's comments: Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 212-3 For more info on this style of cosmetic spoon, see: Kozloff, Arielle P. 1998. ‘The decorative and funerary arts during the reign of Amenhotep III’. In O'Connor, David B. and Eric H. Cline (eds), Amenhotep III: perspectives on his reign. Ann Arbor: University of Michigan Press, 95-123. ‘Ritual Implements and Related Statuettes’ in Kozloff, Arielle P. and Betsy M. Bryan (eds) 1992. Egypt's dazzling sun: Amenhotep III and his world. With Lawrence M. Berman and an essay by Elisabeth Delange. Cleveland, OH: Cleveland Museum of Art, 331-59.
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
